page.title: 03St.Helen's School Alveston
page.content: St.Helens school is a primary school near Bristol.There are ten classes in the school and about 310 children.We have a very large playing field and a football pitch and an outdoor swimming pool which we only use on very warm days.There are two playgrounds one junior and the other an infant playground.The roof of the school always has a leak in it somewhere.In class ten we had a leak in the roof.It came down onto the boards under the roof and the boards held the water then it fell down.There is a big hall for assembly and dinner.The school has a little wood in its grounds.Our class is doing a survey on it and we are trying to make a wildlife area in it so that people may come and see it.At the bottom of our field there is a boundary made out of trees and bushes which is over a thousand years old.
